very nice game good story with tricky moments awesome art and better balance after the last balance rework some moments i would improve but overall i recommend to play the game if you are a big fan of good rpgstrategy mix games

ash of god is an interesting rpg it immersed me into the story as well as gameplay hopefully to see more of this style in the future
please fix the translation the story seems like it would be good but the translation really pulls me from immersion and on occasion comprehension

i like the grim dark story setting and the greyish characters as well as the focus on story telling it is a bit sad that the map leaves you with the illusion of having a world to explore when you can only follow a fix 14 paths and have strict ressource limitations which make sense in the setting if you do not like such railroading and the almost visual novel like story telling you will not like this game however

the game throws you in the middle of a fantasy world and doesnt do a good job of explaining the lore through the story so some homework is required to figure out whowhatwhere all the peopleplacesevents its referring to are but once you know how the world fits together the story becomes fun and engaging

first off the art is amazing the reason i picked up this game  the game plays itself it auto battles from the start and i am currently on my way to beating the game without playing any of the battles i pick my upgrades but really its more of a choose your own adventure book with good art

i honestly enjoyed the game i loved the gritty atmosphere of the story and the dark fantasy there was a lot of lore and its easy to get lost i definitely want to do another playthrough at some point combat wasnt the worst and i got used to the mechanics the art style was beautiful and i liked most of characters if you enjoyed the banner saga you should give this game a chance solid 710

the game improved a lot since the release i gave it another chance and it felt way more fun i hope they keep the cool combathistory and make a sequel in the future

a very good storytelling game with a gameplay quite similar to the one of the banner saga which you should definitely try if you havent yet this one is harder though more punishing not in choices but in gameplay and has a very interesting aesthetic and story that will make you come back to its world and story even years after youve done it  thats what its done to me at least if youre hesitating dont dont pass it up and give it a try

pros  interesting story nice art style  cons boring gameplay mechanics fighting mechanics are terrible choices dont seem to matter that much the huge map does not really invite you to explore it very few enemy classes items seem a bit useless it lacks the depth of other similar games like the banner saga for example  for 56 euros its ok but i feel like that is as much as i would pay for a game like this a bit disappointed really
surprising fun visual novel  tbrpg

the turnbased combat has a bit of jank but once it clicked i enjoyed it character dialogue is hitandmiss but i liked the overall setting and story i understand its based on a book series so might look into reading those theres a fair number of story choices that affect what scenescombats occur and who survives to the final scenes i dont feel compelled to replay to see the different branches but its there if thats what you are into
nice game good story
half book reading  half banner saga  worked for me and finished the game play it it is good

was really excited to play a turn based story game with this aesthetic but an hour in im giving up the story is an interesting fight for survival but every dialogue is so wordy that it loses all appeal the first introduction into the party mechanics was telling me i needed two teams to battle to a gate and another for a distraction i got plopped right into a fight with half the people i shouldve brought with no mention of the distraction again

not a full review since i couldnt play it much endless dialogue which constantly pans viewpoints between the same 2 characters it gave me motion sickness combat animations are real slow  do yourselves a favor and go into options and immediately kick that up to 3x the narrator and the subtitles dont match which is a small peeve for a normal game but this game felt like 80 text scrawl
ash of gods redemption is a buggy game to the point where the story breaks down and loses its meaning its really disappointing to have spent time on it

so this is one of those odd titles the story is really interesting the combat is challenging but fair the art work is gorgeous but for some reason after putting the game down i had absolutely no desire whatsoever to start it back up maybe its just that this isnt really my type of game if the turned based combat game is your preferred genre youll probably love this i cant personally recommend it but im still rating it as an 810
